subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Is this group defunct?
msgSnippet: In the very early days of Quikscript when I belonged to a correspondence circle started by Kingsley Read, we had correspondents from the UK, USA and Australia
messageBody:
In the very early days of Quikscript when I belonged to a correspondence circle started by Kingsley Read, we had correspondents from the UK, USA and Australia from time to time. All these people used their own phonetic pronunciation, which, though it may have made it a bit more difficult to read, it made it quite possible to read in the accent of the writer, and was no less understandable than listening to their speech.

Personally, I would be against standardisation other than of abbreviated small words in Senior QS (which I make full use of).

Because the correspondence circle was one where every letter went to every person, and when it returned to oneself, one replace one's last letter with a new one, and in those days (the late 60's) it was not so easy to make copies, i only have a few letters from KR which were sent direct to me.  However, I do have this correspondence and will be happy to share with the group on request and in due course.
